title: Poster, "Public Theater, New York: Dancing on Her Knees", 1995
medium: Screen print on white wove paper
inscribed:
Down right side of poster, forming a block of text: THE PUBLIC THEATER, followed by Sher's characteristic 'token' (logo) in yellow and purple for "Lu Ester/Lab/Hall".  425 Lafayette Street/ (212) 260-2400/ WRITTEN BY NILO CRUZ /DIRECTED BY GRACIELA DANIELS. 
Signed (printed) in image lower right corner: DESIGN:PENTAGRAM
description: Image divided into two sections. Upper section shows a woman's leg (seen from behind) wearing a yellow stocking and a black heeled shoe. Green fringe from skirt visible at upper left corner. Image runs from upper left to lower right on a diagonal against a vivid red background. Lower section shows purple letters outlined in yellow against a black background.  Spelling "Dancing on Her Knees" the text moves from lower left to right, ending at the tip of the woman's shoe.  Inscribed text along right side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Public Theater, New York: Dancing on Her Knees", 1995.
1995. Screen print on white wove paper. Gift of Pentagram. 1998-2-3.
